reviewText: This is one of the most difficult games I have ever played. It requires the most precise mouse movements I've ever seen in a game. So lets this be a warning to any noobs that think beating Ninja Gaiden makes you some sorta pro, this game with destroy you. I found it helps if you are using a Cathode Ray Tube monitor from 1992. The dialogue is really deep. Everytime Putt-putt asks me what game I would like to play I get chills and the relationship Putt-putt and Fatty bear share is simply heart warming. You really feel a connection to them almost like you have real friends. Careful though because it can be very addicting. If you are prone to vice, this game is like heorine compared to World of Warcraft. This game has been known to take peoples' lives away. All and all, this game makes me regret owning any other steam game because for all the time I spent playing them I could have been playing this. 1000/10. Buy this game.

reviewText:
I bought this game for my 2 yr old grandson,Elijah . .  With him being 2,I of course,have to help him quite a lot and that being said I think this is a really cute game for the 10 and under crowd. . .

There are lots of activities to do in this game for older kids. Right now about all Elijah can do is the picture painting and he completely loves doing that. . . The older he gets,the more he will be able to play. . .

I think I picked this one up for 39 cents and in my opinion I would have paid up to $3.99 for it,its well worth it.Some of the activities are checkers,painting,a memory type game,word finds and a game we call Dots"
date: where you have to make random lines on a grid of dots
recommended: in hopes of making boxes before your opponent does
hoursPlayed: the one with the most completed boxes by the end of the game

reviewText:
An Instant Childhood Classic from the Days of my Childhood which is a joy to play for Windows PCs, MS-DOS PCs & even the Panasonic 3DO Consoles in which you have 15 Different Games to play which combines Putt-Putt's Fun Pack & Fatty Bear's Fun Pack into one game including a 35 Page Coloring Book, in addition, it also contains 4 new games in Putt-Putt & Fatty Bear's Activity Pack.

As for the Voices in the game, I prefer the US Version over the Japanese Version when it comes to the Panasonic 3DO Import Version.

All of the Humongous Entertainment Titles can be played by people of ALL AGES (Young & Old alike), there will nothing that's unsuitable & the whole family can enjoy Humongous Entertainment's World of Fun & Learning.

reviewText: Here is the first and only cross over game Humongous Entertainment ever made. It's also the only other game to star Fatty Bear who only had one game as oppose to Putt-Putt who starred in several games and a few spin-offs. Anyways this game immediately starts up in a mini game menu hosted by Fatty & Putt-Putt. No intro, plot, or goal for this game the only thing to do is just play any of the given games with either Fatty or Putt-Putt as the opponents. It's sorta like a predecessor to Pajama Sam's Games to Play on Any Day. And there isn't much else to say about the content of the game. I am surprised that Humongous Entertainment never made any other cross over games on their other games. It's common for them to have various characters making cameos in each others games but never a game where they actually speak to one or another. Putt-Putt would go on to star in a few more mini game theme spin off games like this one. While Fatty Bear sadly never got a shot at being in more games. Overrall this game is worth playing for die hard Humongous Game fans.
